sentences.sContent: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.sCn: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

sentences.sContent: ...It also adds the element of artistic creativity to attract a new pool of students who may not see themselves as math people...
...On the western side of the lake are the well-known Bird Islands which attract birdwatchers from across the globe...
...these18-hour cities are beginning to make waves in real estate rankings and attract more reaestate investment...
...Dragon Boat racing and the beauty of Dongting Lake and the surrounding area attract thousands of tourists at home and abroad each year...
...more people will be looking for jobs and the pressure on employers to raise wages to attract workers will decline...
...Teachers need to be much better paid to attract the best college graduates to the nation's worst schools...
...enough to attract the attention of major companies that might not otherwise be interested in a decidedly pedestrian technology...
...Businesses that attract top ratings can enjoy rapid growth...
...What arc universities trying to do to attract students...
...It is our responsibility to reach out and attract students to come to our kinds of places...

phrases.pCn: 吸引外商投资；对外招商

remMethod.val: at(表加强) ＋ tract(拉) → 拉过来 → 吸引

words.tran: 吸引人的；有魅力的；引人注目的
迷人地；有吸引力地；动人地
吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物
[自] 吸引子；引起注意的人

trans.tranOther: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something
